description: The Japanese Hornbeam (Carpinus japonica) is truly a magnificent and unique tree species! Native to Japan, this evergreen tree has a distinctive, multi-faceted trunk leading to a wonderfully bushy, dense canopy. Its simple, glossy green leaves will turn a beautiful golden-yellow in autumn and winter. The Japanese Hornbeam can live for more than 200 years, making it an incredibly rugged and reliable species. It is also relatively drought-tolerant and can thrive in both shade and full sun. It's perfect for urban settings, as it is highly resistant to air pollution and requires little maintenance. The Japanese Hornbeam is truly an amazing tree species!
